content: the first tentacle chain 1 and bind off you will notice that the tentacles have a natural tendency to curl photo 9 1 2 3 4 5 6 8 9 7 10 you can add the eyes at this point but it is much easier to place them accurately once the head and its lids have been attached to their respective wedges 5 now you will need to attach 3 wedge lids to the right side of the head so with the front of the head facing you and a slip knot already on your hook join your yarn to the end of round 7 of the head with a slip_stitch this is where you placed the blue st marker work 3 wedge lids as before when you get to the end of the third lid chain 1 but don t bind off assembling the head and wedges segment place one of the wedges behind the first wedge lid with the seam of the wedge to the right insert your hook into the first st of the lid and the first st of the wedge make a single_crochet continue working a single_crochet through both layers into each st of the wedge and each row of the lid until you have made 15 single_crochet s add the next wedge in the same way again working 15 single_crochet s through both layers continue working around until you have attached one side of each of the 3 lids now you will be attaching the last wedge to the back of the head the head pivots around the last lid and will naturally fall so that the top of the head is pointing upwards and the back is pointing towards you because of the weight of the tentacles to attach the head you will be making 15 single_crochet s through the bottom of the opening at the back of the head and the first side of the wedge so both layers followed by 15 single_crochet s around the top of the opening and the other side of the wedge so both layers again insert your hook into the first st the stitch containing the blue st marker this st already contains a slip_stitch join from the lid now insert your hook into the first st of one of the wedges as before photos 1 and 2 below make a single_crochet through both layers photo 3 make 7 more single_crochet s working into each row down the incline of the head and each st of the wedge photo 4 1 2 3 4 you will notice a loop at the base of the incline photo 5 single_crochet through this loop and the next st of the wedge now continue working 6 more single_crochet s into the row of the incline and the st s of the wedge photo 6 this will bring you to the white st marker photo 7 loop please note the blue running st marker in this photo should be yellow 5
